name: Magic Barrage - Bitferno
description: Magic Barrage - Bitferno is a top down style free to play action MMORPG with intense PvP and PvE combat. Play as one of the 8 classes and go on an epic adventure to save, or destroy the world.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or higher Memory: 512 MB RAM Storage: 100 MB available space

Hrm... Can't really tell what this game is about. I finally decided to write a review based on my .3 hours of playtime. In short: I installed, had a black screen for about 20 minutes, then closed the window and uninstalled. I tried playing 5 minutes after it was released, admittedly. And I was kinda expecting some excitement at being one of the first to play it as it was released on steam. 5/10 would go through similar circumstances again (with it loading properly, of course).

Its not bad if you like 8bit mmo games, I have been playing for a bit now and I slightly enjoy the game. It's a fun way to throw away a quick 30 minutes a day if you are bored. It isnt too pay2win, most bought items CAN be purchased using ingame currency. This games liking is a matter of opinion and gamechoice over anything.  Rating : 7/10 Would play again

I think that this game is fun and for everyone who says its a pay to win, its not, if you have ever played realm of the mad god then you know that this is a prettier knock off of that game. The premice of the game is not to get the best items and look cool its to kill things and finish quests. So the game is playable without having to buy items, you are able to play all the way through. The only time you can buy items, is when you want to buy some stupid gear with real money which in reality you can buy with the ingame currency or by somehow crafting it. So i think this is not a pay to win and that you can play for as long as you like without having to buy things will real life money.

I'm going to be honest... I don't see what is making all the hate on this game, I have played a fair bit, and i find it very enjoyable. its kind of like, realm of the mad god upgraded.   There are 3 things this game doesnt have that realm of the mad god has, full screen, permadeath and an oceanic server.   Full screen i would like, it would make it a lot more enjoyable experience playing the game in my opinion. though i would like to state that realm of the mad god had weird scaling issues when it went to full screen so i'm not completely sure if i can count that as an advantage over this.   As for perma-death, it is my most hated system UNLESS you have some kind of progression system in the game that is built upon death. like rogue leagacy's coins gathering mechanic. Realm of the Mad God took this idea and completely murdered it, making you spend real money to get what, in my opinion, should be the progression currency. (for example you need to buy gold coins to unlock more classes)  Lastly the oceanic server, this is clearly purely because i live in australia, for most people this wouldnt be an issue  Back to this game however, it has more classes, more abilities, it has a pet system which add active and passive abilities to your character. I guess you don't have things like Archer arrows penetrate but in Realm of the mad god but honestly, 4-6x the active abilities makes me not care.   I see some people saying about the whole paying model? I mean yes it's there... It's a free to play game, are you new to the concept of in game stores to pay for bonuses? It's a very common free to play model and is, in my opinion, one of the best.   Those who say they are constantly bombarded with things telling them to buy stuff or that it always opens windows going to their 'buy diamonds' page, i don't know what you're doing wrong but i've not had any of this at all. There is a little store button down the bottom? If you click on that you will go to the store i'm sure... Besides that, it's the normal free to play game stuff.   I have played many free to play games and personally am quite used to the systems in place here. I believe this game could be a spiritual successor to realm of the mad god, if that's what you're looking for, welcome.
10/10 would barrage again!!

This is a really good contestant for the title 'The Worst Game of 2015'.  Animations? Really terrible. Soundtrack? Not that great either. Bugs? Tons of them. Concept? Boring. Gameplay? Even more boring.  This game looked not that bad from the pictures and such, so I downloaded it, after all - what is 1MB to download lol. I tell you, not even worth the 1 MB . You get kicked into an island without any story whatsoever, with 2 keys to play with except the moving WASD keys.... So you press left mouse to shoot and 1\space to preform a skill. I found myself holding the left mouse key for infinity with the most unsatisfying attacking animation in history, then to realize the skill looks even worse... Apart from shooting tiny little pixels of nothing for 5 minutes I found a statue of a crab (?) that led me into a duengeon which I just rushed into the boss because the monsters do nothing and take way too long to kill. A lvl 1 Assasins vs A lvl 8 Boss... I really tried hard, but I just couldnt die. I stood afk for almost 2 minutes and he barely damaged me... Are you kidding me?.... Maybe the late game is better but all the sound fx bugs and the animations are just too much to play untill the late game.
If AIDS and EBOLA had a baby, it would be better than this game.

At first glance from the screenshots the games looks rather interesting. So I went to download the game (size of 1MB) and wasn't expecting anything too great. When you first launch the game it starts to download game files (why coulnd't it just donwnload them through steam?) and you are greeted with a 'Choose class/create character' screen. No customization to characters or anything. Once you have choosen your class and your name, you will be thrown into the game after a character selection menu. Game downloads more files (or just tries to establish a connection) and then you will be thrown into middle of enemies with other players and music. No sound effects, except the characters making weird noise when taking dmg. I immediately quit the game after noticing that the game was pretty much a Realm of the Mad God (which is a much better and playable game imo) copy. I would have liked to have another game LIKE RotMD. Not a copy of it. Yes, I did only play for 5 minutes, but that was enough for this game imo.

I'm going to keep playing so my review may change, but at this point I don't recomend this game. I love the similarities between this and 'Realm of the Mad God', I love the character choices, and I love that there are quests. My problems with this game stem from the fact that the difficulty ramps up around lvl 20, there is no real story so there's no need to read the quest descriptions, and after about 15 minutes I was so bored that I only kept playing to see if the game would get any interesting at higher levels.  Pros:  Character selection  Rogue-like design  Quests  Cons:  Difficulty spike  Quests have no meaning  Boring (though this might be good for insomniacs)
